items.preText:
Carl: "I am so afraid for the WI with this bowling attack at CWC 19."

Roach returns.
items.text: back of a length, slanting away into a fifth-stump line. Looks for the front-foot pull and misses
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: brilliant. Short, waist-high ball on off stump, and this is a straight-bat pull, almost a scoop over midwicket, and he easily clears the boundary
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, SIX runs

items.text: length ball slanting across the stumps, looks to slog across the line and inside-edges into his pad
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: shortish on off stump, pulled in the air, but on the bounce, to deep midwicket. He's got to be careful with this shot now that that fielder has dropped back

short ball on off stump, rises pretty steeply, and it looks like he was early on the pull. The ball misses his top edge and hits him on the grille of the helmet. Doesn't spend too long nursing his wound. Takes his helmet off, checks if the grille is fastened properly, gives his head a bit of a shake, and puts it back on
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: what a reply. Another short ball, a little bit wider of off stump, and he pulls it all the way over the square leg boundary
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, SIX runs

items.preText: Raymon Reifer comes on now. Left-arm over to Soumya.
items.text: short outside off, extra bounce beats the attempted uppercut
items.shortText: Reifer to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: slower length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and plays his favourite dab to third man, off the front foot this time
back of a length outside off, stabbed to the left of deep point

steps away from leg stump premeditatedly, creates a lot of room, and Reifer bowls a full slower ball, much slower than his typical pace, outside off. Reaches for it and bottom-edges past his leg stump
items.shortText: Reifer to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: length ball wide of off stump, carved to deep point
short slower one outside off, beats Mushfiqur, who's through his pull too early.
items.postText: And with that, it's over to Sreshth for the rest of this chase. Bye!
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full, on off, and lifted over the bowler's head. Long off there
nice! Full, on leg, and the attempted sweep is played pretty fine. Short fine leg can't cut it off, and neither can deep square leg
items.postText: Hridoy: "Team Bangladesh are getting mature every new morning. If they continue to play this way then they will be team to defeat in every format. Specially ODI. Such a balanced ODI side."
items.shortText: Nurse to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: team hundred! That's the fastest hundred in Bangladesh's ODI history. Full, on off, and reverse swept to the deep point region
length ball, on middle and angling in. Sarkar walks down the ground, and punches to mid on
items.shortText: Nurse to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: length ball, just outside off, and slapped over the infield to deep point
length ball, just outside off, and cut square to Allen at deep point
items.postText: NK: "@sreshth..was sabbir's one a out?" -- ball stayed low. Looked out to me!

items.text: paddled over the keeper! Length ball on middle, and Mushfiqur opens his chest to play that shot. Finds the ball near his chest, and comfortably paddles it over Hope's head
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, just outside off, and guided to third man for a single
slower ball, but wayward. Very wide outside off
items.postText: Jobaer: "@Hridoy, perhaps you are a bit too enthusiastic BD fan. Yes, Bangladesh is improving and showing maturity, especially in the ODI format but they are definitely not THE team to beat. ----A BD fan from Memphis, Tennessee"

items.text: another one! Faster from Reifer, but too wide outside off stump. Left alone by Sarkar

full, very wide outside off, and he throws his hands at this. Tries to slap it over long off, but toe-ends the shot. Cottrell makes no mistake running in from long off. Replays suggest that Reifer had overstepped but a closer look suggests that it's a legal ball. The foot had dragged out of the crease after the initial contact with the ground. Huge wicket

dismissal.text: Soumya Sarkar c sub (SS Cottrell) b Reifer 66 (41b 9x4 3x6) SR: 160.97

items.text: length ball, angling in from around the wicket. Nudged off his hips to fine leg
full, outside off, and driven to the deep cover boundary
